hackathon-description-text: MenloHacks is the official hackathon for the Menlo School in Atherton, CA. We will be gathering 250 high school students this spring for 24 hours to build anything pertaining to hardware or software.
hackathon-requirements: If you are hacking remotely, please upload a 2-3 minute video describing your project that we will show to our judges.
hackathon-rules:
You must only work on your project during the event.  You must abide by the 
 and any instructions or rules given by chaperones and organizers during the event.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 400 dollars in cash for team + tablet for each member.
200 dollars in cash for the team.
100 dollars in cash for the team.
A Mini Drone for each member of the team.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Entrepreneurial Sponsored by MIT Launch

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The best hack done by a team exclusively composed of first time hackathon attendees will receive a license to JetBrains IDE. Please only opt into this if your team is composed entirely for first time hackers.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack Hosted on a .TECH Domain

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 1TB hard drive for each team member
Swag bags with SparkFun Redboards to each team member.
Octocat Statue to the winning team.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Developer Tool sponsored by Github

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=50 Valparaiso Ave, Atherton, CA 94027, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is your project unique or original?  Does it take an interesting or creative approach to a problem?
Is your project technically impressive?  Is it more than just a few mockup designs or a landing page?
Does your project solve a problem that actually exists?  Is it feasible for people to use this product in the real world?
Does your project look nice?  Does it have a design interface or design?

hackathon-description-header: 200 Hackers. All in high school. Come join us on April 16-17 for Menlo School's first hackathon.
